org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.validator

Class BaseCertificateValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.ieee1609dot2.validator.BaseCertificateValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CertificateValidator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ETSI103097CertificateValidator

    public abstract class BaseCertificateValidator
extends java.lang.Object
implements CertificateValidator
    Base Class for validating a certificate chain, using time, region, permission and signature.

    • Method Detail

      • verifyAndValidate

        public void verifyAndValidate(Certificate certificate,
                              java.util.Date checkDate,
                              GeographicRegion checkRegion,
                              EndEntityType targetEndEntityType,
                              java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> certStore,
                              java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> trustStore,
                              boolean entireChain)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              InvalidCertificateException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method that verifies and validates all permissions on the build certificate chain.

        The method will build a chain for the certificate from the set of known certificates and the trust anchors.

        For each certificate in the built chain it will check.
        • Signature verifies
        • Certificates validity
        • Region matches
        • App Permissions/Cert Issue Permissions

        The method does not currently check revocation information.

        Permissions is only checked that it is consistent upwards in the chain. It does not check a specific permission

        Specified by:
        verifyAndValidate in interface CertificateValidator
        Parameters:
        certificate - the certificate to verify and validate
        checkDate - the date to check validity of certificate chain against.
        checkRegion - the region to check against, if null is region check skipped.
        targetEndEntityType - the type of end entity tree to check.
        certStore - a certstore that contains all intermediate CA certificates that is needed to build the chain.
        trustStore - a certstore of root ca certificates that are trusted.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters where invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if one of the certificate in the build certificate chain was invalid.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if use hash algorithm isn't supported by the system.

      • verifyAndValidate

        public void verifyAndValidate(Certificate certificate,
                              java.util.Date checkDate,
                              GeographicRegion checkRegion,
                              EndEntityType targetEndEntityType,
                              int chainLengthIndex,
                              java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> certStore,
                              java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> trustStore,
                              boolean entireChain)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              InvalidCertificateException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method that verifies and validates all permissions on the build certificate chain.

        The method will build a chain for the certificate from the set of known certificates and the trust anchors.

        For each certificate in the built chain it will check.
        • Signature verifies
        • Certificates validity
        • Region matches
        • App Permissions/Cert Issue Permissions

        The method does not currently check revocation information.

        Permissions is only checked that it is consistent upwards in the chain. It does not check a specific permission

        Specified by:
        verifyAndValidate in interface CertificateValidator
        Parameters:
        certificate - the certificate to verify and validate
        checkDate - the date to check validity of certificate chain against.
        checkRegion - the region to check against, if null is region check skipped.
        targetEndEntityType - the type of end entity tree to check.
        chainLengthIndex - index parameter send to retrieve the correct group permissions from certificate. If validating chain that starts with end entity certificate should chainLengthIndex be 0, if certificate chain starts with issuer of end entity certificate it should be 1 and so on incremented up to root certificate in chain.
        certStore - a certstore that contains all intermediate CA certificates that is needed to build the chain.
        trustStore - a certstore of root ca certificates that are trusted.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters where invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if one of the certificate in the build certificate chain was invalid.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if use hash algorithm isn't supported by the system.

      • verifyAndValidate

        public void verifyAndValidate(Certificate[] certificateChain,
                              java.util.Date checkDate,
                              GeographicRegion checkRegion,
                              EndEntityType targetEndEntityType,
                              boolean entireChain)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              InvalidCertificateException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method that verifies and validates all permissions on a known certificate chain data. The end entity certificate should be in position 0 and root certificate last.

        The method will build a chain for the certificate from the set of known certificates and the trust anchors.

        For each certificate in the built chain it will check.

        • Signature verifies
        • Certificates validity
        • Region matches
        • App Permissions/Cert Issue Permissions

        The method does not currently check revocation information.

        Permissions is only checked that it is consistent upwards in the chain. It does not check a specific permission

        Specified by:
        verifyAndValidate in interface CertificateValidator
        Parameters:
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to verify and validate. The end entity certificate should be in position 0 and root certificate last.
        checkDate - the date to check validity of certificate chain against.
        checkRegion - the region to check against, if null is region check skipped.
        targetEndEntityType - the type of end entity tree to check.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters where invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if one of the certificate in the build certificate chain was invalid.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if use hash algorithm isn't supported by the system.

      • verifyAndValidate

        public void verifyAndValidate(Certificate[] certificateChain,
                              java.util.Date checkDate,
                              GeographicRegion checkRegion,
                              EndEntityType targetEndEntityType,
                              int chainLengthIndex,
                              boolean entireChain)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              InvalidCertificateException,
                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Method that verifies and validates all permissions on a known certificate chain data. The end entity certificate should be in position 0 and root certificate last.

        The method will build a chain for the certificate from the set of known certificates and the trust anchors.

        For each certificate in the built chain it will check.

        • Signature verifies
        • Certificates validity
        • Region matches
        • App Permissions/Cert Issue Permissions

        The method does not currently check revocation information.

        Permissions is only checked that it is consistent upwards in the chain. It does not check a specific permission

        Specified by:
        verifyAndValidate in interface CertificateValidator
        Parameters:
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to verify and validate. The end entity certificate should be in position 0 and root certificate last.
        checkDate - the date to check validity of certificate chain against.
        checkRegion - the region to check against, if null is region check skipped.
        targetEndEntityType - the type of end entity tree to check.
        chainLengthIndex - index parameter send to retrieve the correct group permissions from certificate. If validating chain that starts with end entity certificate should chainLengthIndex be 0, if certificate chain starts with issuer of end entity certificate it should be 1 and so on incremented up to root certificate in chain.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters where invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if one of the certificate in the build certificate chain was invalid.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if use hash algorithm isn't supported by the system.

      • buildCertChain

        protected Certificate[] buildCertChain(Certificate certificate,
                                       java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> certStore,
                                       java.util.Map<HashedId8,Certificate> trustStore)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       InvalidCertificateException,
                                       java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Help method to build a certificate chain with given certificate first up to root certificate last in returned array.
        Parameters:
        certificate - the certificate to build chain up to root ca for.
        certStore - map of known certificates ids to certificate, used to build up the chain to the trust store root certificates.
        trustStore - map of trusted root certificate ids to certificate.
        Returns:
        a complete certificate chain up to root certificate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if one of the parameters where invalid.
        InvalidCertificateException - if one of the certificate in the build certificate chain was invalid.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if use hash algorithm isn't supported by the system.

      • verifyCertificateChain

        protected void verifyCertificateChain(Certificate[] certChain,
                                      boolean entireChain)
                               throws InvalidCertificateException
        Method to verify the signature for all certificates in the chain up to the root certificate.
        Parameters:
        certChain - the certificate chain to verify with end entity certificate first.
        entireChain - if entireChain should be validated or only first certificate in chain.
        Throws:
        InvalidCertificateException - if one or more of the certificate up to root CA had invalid signature.

      • isSelfSigned

        public static boolean isSelfSigned(Certificate certificate)
        Method to check if issuer of certificate is self signed.
        Parameters:
        certificate - the certificate to check
        Returns:
        true if self signed.

      • toIEEE1609Certificates

        public static Certificate[] toIEEE1609Certificates(Certificate[] certificateChain)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to cast given certificate to ieee1609dot2 or throw IllegalArgumentException if certificate is of wrong type.
        Parameters:
        certificateChain - the certificate chain to cast to ieee1609dot2
        Returns:
        ieee1609dot2 variant of the certificate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
